isis.stitle: TSI 96-06-01 - Spicer Life Series SPL-170 and SPL-250 Propeller Shafts

subjectgroup.subject: Spicer Life Series SPL-170 and SPL-250 Propeller Shafts

geninfo.para: Effective October 1996, the Spicer Life Series SPL-170 and SPL-250 propeller shafts will become available on 2000, 8000 and 9000 Models. Features include permanently lubricated slip joint and extended lubrication cycle for the U-joint (100,000 miles in line-haul applications). U-Joint Kit bearing and seal designs have been improved for extended service life.
During scheduled maintenance, it is important to recognize the SPL series from greaseable propeller shafts to prevent premature failure due to lack of lubrication.

SPL-170 and SPL-250 propeller shafts have a boot over the slip spline and no grease zerk ( Figure 1). The factory grease fill is permanent and does not need to be replenished. The U-joint has a zerk fitting and is to be lubricated at 100,000 mile intervals for line-haul applications and 25,000 miles for off-highway and city service, following the recommendations in Group 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Additionally, the stamped bearing straps have been replaced with machined bearing straps for increased durability ( Figure 2). Strap mounting bolts are tightened to 100 to 120 ft-lbs. (135 to 160 Nm) of torque. The spring straps on tube yokes are tightened to 25 to 30 ft-lbs. (35 to 40 Nm) of torque ( Figure 3).
All greaseable propeller shafts follow the lubrication intervals and recommendations listed in Group 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
